Package enigma

Class Machine

java.lang.Object
enigma.Machine
public class Machine
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents an Enigma machine

  • Constructor Details

    • Machine

      public Machine​(PlugBoard plugBoard, Reflector reflector, RotorGroup rotorGroup)
      Parameters:
      plugBoard - A enigma.PlugBoard object that will be the plugboard of this Enigma machine that helps in message encryption
      reflector - A enigma.Reflector object that will be used as a reflector of this Enigma machine that helps in message encryption
      rotorGroup - A enigma.RotorGroup object that will be used as a "collection of rotors" for this enigma machine and help in message encryption

  • Method Details

    • getMachineBySetting

      public static Machine getMachineBySetting​(java.lang.String reflectorName, java.lang.String[] rotorNames, int[] settings, java.lang.String[] plugBoardWiring)
      A method that allows one to create a machine very easily using String representation of all the required Enigma machine components. This is useful if one wants the user to enter rotor names, reflector name, plugboard settings etc, and it will create an Enigma machine object automatically
      Parameters:
      reflectorName - The name of the reflector that will be used. The name must be there in the enigma.WiringData class
      rotorNames - The names of the rotors to be used by the machine. The name must be there in the enigma.WiringData class
      settings - The settings of the rotors of the Enigma machine. The number of settings given must be same as number of rotors and must be such an order such that each setting is for to the name of the corresponding rotor given in the rotorNames array
      plugBoardWiring - The String representation of the plug board
      Returns:
      The created Enigma machine object

    • getChar

      public char getChar​(char ch)
      Takes an UPPERCASE character as an input and returns the encrypted/decrypted character in UPPERCASE
      Parameters:
      ch - The UPPERCASE character that will be encrypted/decrypted
      Returns:
      The UPPERCASE character that has been encrypted/decrypted

    • convertMessage

      public java.lang.String convertMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Takes a message and encrypts/decrypts it. Here, case does not matter as everything is converted to uppercase. Even special characters can be used, however, they will be left as-it-is. They will neither be encrypted not decrypted.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be encrypted/decrypted
      Returns:
      The encrypted/decrypted message

    • convertStringToArray

      public static java.lang.String[] convertStringToArray​(java.lang.String str)
      Converts a single String into array, by splitting it using the space character. It gets rid of any special characters and makes everything uppercase. This is useful to convert a String entered by a user into a enigma.RotorGroup or a plugboard where everything needs to be uppercase and special characters typed by mistake should be ignored.
      Parameters:
      str - The String to be converted.
      Returns:
      The resultant array.

    • advance

      public void advance()
      Advances the machine's rotors by one setting

    • getRotorSettingsStr

      public java.lang.String getRotorSettingsStr()
      Returns:
      The settings of all the rotors in the form of a String

    • setRotorSettings

      public void setRotorSettings​(java.lang.String settingsStr)
      Sets the rotor settings
      Parameters:
      settingsStr - The new settings of the rotors in the form of a Strings
